text:
On tap. Pours a super cloudy orange with a thick white head. Aroma of citrus, light fruits, floral hops, rye malt. Flavor of rye malt, grassy hops, earthy hops, citrus, light fruits, bitter hops. Tasty, very hoppy as well with nice eye malt backbone.
7/4/8/4/14 (3.7/5)
Draft - pours yellow white head - nose/taste of rye, lemon and citrus - medium body
Draft pour. The beer is a clear gold with a white head of foam. Mild spice and sweet, subtle bitterness. Spice in the finish. Medium body and medium carbonation.

On tap at Caliente. Pours a hazy gold with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong citrus, mango, dank hop. Medium body, juicy hop, citrus, dank, light rye, nice bitter finish, very good.
Draft - Lots of tropical fruits and Mandarin. Clear gold with a nice white head. Nice citrus and Mandarin notes. Tasty.
Sampled at Caliente. A little haze in this golden beer. White foam. Decently hopped with rye and citrus. Grain and spice. Melons. Good.
On tap at TJs. Poured a golden color with a smaller sized head. Citrus, rye, some earthiness, and a fruity sweetness.

Pours golden mostly clear with a lacey white head. Sweet orange zest is nice on the nose and flavor, just too light on the nose. Opens up nicely and light on the rye spiciness, which my palate prefers!
Draft at the source. Clear golden yellow color, fluffy white head. Aroma of spiced raw bread dough. Taste is dusty, peppery, spiced.

Pours a hazy golden with a moderate white head... Aroma has big notes of mango, some light earthiness but mostly fruit... The rye/earthy character comes out in the flavor much more than the aroma... Fruit flavors are subtle come out in the finish... Medium body easy drinking...
Draft. Clear apple juice body with medium white head. Aroma is medium sweet, rye, some grapefruit, bread. Taste is medium sweet, pine/grapefruit, some rye. Light-medium body, light resin.

Pours gold with a medium creamy white head...great lacing and retention. Aroma has great tangerine and orange notes with hints of grassy spice. Flavor follows suit and adds a nice layer of earthy rye spice...solid bitterness...touch of grapefruit rind. Mouthfeel is light / medium and lively with a dry rindy grapefruity/rye spice finish. Beautifully done.

Tap at the brewery. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with excellent lacing. Aroma is spicy and earthy rye malt, earthy, pine and resin hops. Flavor is heavy hops and bitterness, light rye malt and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

mini growler? from summer santa; not a huge fan of rye ipa; so take review for what it is worth... taste was of hops like an ipa but had a smoother/better finish than may ipas. just not an enjoyable drink to me.
This name is an oxymoron because this beer certainly does not suck.  Nice hoppy and spicy character to it.  Tingly mouth feel.  Good stuff.

Growler. Another great beer exclaiming how much it sucks. I think I may have a "thing" for rye IPAs, but this is incredibly drinkable and balanced. Didn't pick up any off flavors from the growler like the other beer I picked up either.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2013 Served on-tap at Als of Hampden.

A - Pours clear pale yellow with a nice one finger tall white head leaving sticky webs of lace down most of the glass.

S - Smells of grassy hops, dash of tropical fruit, pine needles, dulled spicy rye and a tiny bit of booze once it warms up. The rye plays second fiddle to the hops, which is fine by me.

T - Starts off with plenty of hop bitterness, both tropical and grassy, slowly giving way to hints of the backing spicy rye and a touch of booze. Finish is kinda bready with some hop bitterness mixed in, lingering on the palate long after the finish. A bit muted when fresh from the taps, gets better as it warms up in the glass.

M - Smooth, bready feel with plenty of hop bitterness. This is where the rye really comes through, providing a solid backing for all the hops to play off of.

O - It fits the description quite well. The hops are strong like a typical IPA yet not overpowering thanks to the rye core. A very nice hybrid beer with plenty of flavor that is easy to drink, give it a shot if you get a chance.
